title: George Floyd: The wave of protest songs sparked by his death
description: Lyrics of "rage and mourning" were written in the weeks following the African-American's murder.

title: Belarus plane: What happens with a military jet interception?
description: Simon Browning looks at standard aviation protocols after a "major diplomatic incident" on Sunday.

title: Hinkley C: Hundreds more needed to finish nuclear power station
description: The new jobs will include roles in construction, welding and electrical installation roles.

title: Covid: How the pandemic is affecting your dreams
description: More than year into Covid-19, do people in your dreams wear masks or socially distance?

title: Tech giants fight 'cloud wars' deep in the ocean
description: To boost their services, Google and Facebook are investing in undersea cables that span the world.

title: Exams 2021: How will my grades be assessed this year?
description: Exams have been cancelled for the second year running due to the impact caused by coronavirus.

title: Watch: George Floyd one year on - how sport took a stand against racism
description: One year on from the murder of George Floyd, BBC Sport looks back at how the sporting world has taken a stand against racism in the past 12 months.

title: Covid: Deaf campaigner calls for clear mask research
description: A campaigner is calling for more research into clear masks to stop people feeling isolated.

title: Mouse plague deals fresh blow to Australian farmers
description: After drought, fires and floods, Australia is now in the grip of a devastating mouse plague.

title: Max Mosley: A dizzying intellect; an intimidating man
description: Max Mosley was one of the most influential and important figures in motorsport - and also among the most controversial.

title: Why was the trial so important?
description: Video footage of a US police officer killing an unarmed black man sparked global protests last year.

description: Could Bill Bailey, some drag queens, a rock band, a bhangra act or Ed Sheeran restore some pride?

title: BBC reviews editorial practices after Diana report
description: A review into the corporation's editorial and whistleblowing policies is announced.

title: Eight arrests in Royal Mail text scam investigation
description: One man from London is charged after raids in the city and in Coventry, Birmingham and Essex.

title: Arundel Castle: Mary Queen of Scots beads stolen in raid
description: More than £1m of gold and silver historical artefacts were taken in the burglary on Friday night.

title: Liberty Steel to sell Stocksbridge plant to pay off lender
description: The struggling steel-maker says the move will allow it to pay back one of its main creditors in full.

title: Western powers voice outrage as Belarus accused of hijacking plane
description: The EU considers sanctions after Belarus forced a plane carrying a dissident journalist to land.

title: Euro 2020: Sergio Ramos left out of Spain squad
description: Sergio Ramos is left out of Spain's Euro 2020 squad, but boss Luis Enrique includes Manchester City defender Aymeric Laporte.

title: Trafalgar Square Fourth Plinth: Shortlist announced
description: The Fourth Plinth in Trafalgar Square is home to a rolling commission of artworks.

title: Derbyshire widow's plea for rule change on overloaded lorries
description: Denise Oscroft calls for change after seeing her husband Steven killed by a lump of concrete.

title: Coronavirus: Training dogs to identify the scent of Covid-19
description: Trials are underway with dogs trained to sniff out the coronavirus. If the trails are successful, dogs could aid efforts to prevent super-spreading in busy areas.

title: Parents fear for pupils' mental state at £53,000 fee school
description: Councils fund places at the specialist school in Hackney for pupils with autism and behavioural issues.

title: Sasha Johnson: Black Lives Matter activist critical after shooting, party says
description: Sasha Johnson is being treated in intensive care after being shot in the head, her party says.

title: Mottarone cable car crash: Italy investigates cause of accident
description: Operators of the cable car near Lake Maggiore said maintenance and checks were carried out regularly.

title: Charlie Bit My Finger video to be taken off YouTube after selling for £500,000
description: The piece of internet history will now be taken off YouTube, after more than 880 million views.

title: Samoa's first female PM locked out of parliament by losing opponent
description: Fiame Naomi Mata'afa holds makeshift swearing-in ceremony in a tent after opponent locks the doors.

title: Cheese photo leads to Liverpool drug dealer's downfall
description: Carl Stewart was tracked down after posting an image of Stilton cheese in an online chat.

title: Robson-Kanu left out of Wales training squad
description: Wales name a 28-man squad for a Euro 2020 training camp in Portugal, with West Brom forward Hal Robson-Kanu missing out.

title: Rob Burrow, Stephen Darby & Doddie Weir on their bond and fight for MND awareness
description: Rob Burrow, Stephen Darby and Doddie Weir talk to BBC Breakfast's Sally Nugent about their bond and fight for motor neurone disease (MND) awareness.

title: Cineworld reopening boosted by demand for Peter Rabbit 2
description: The chain, which has seen huge losses in the pandemic, says film fans have flocked back to its cinemas.

title: 'It's harder to deal with success than losing' - Swiatek on defending French Open title
description: As teenager Iga Swiatek prepares to defend her French Open title just seven months after winning it, she tells BBC Sport how she's handling the pressure.

title: Israel-Gaza: How much money does Israel get from the US?
description: Israel gets billions of dollars in US aid - we look at why, and what that money is used for.

description: BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty assess each Premier League club's season - and looks back at his predictions.

title: NI 100: The election that allowed a two-year-old to vote
description: The goat that changed sides and other lesser-known facts about Northern Ireland’s first parliamentary election.

title: Why Indonesia's 'new Bali' is accused of trampling on human rights

title: The Papers: Cancer crisis warning and UK set for 'heat bubble'
